Throwing Stance

Requirement: One-handed objects or melee weapons that lack the Ammunition or Heavy traits.

Lifting your arm above your shoulder and contorting your wrist, you pull back to best propell your weapon with the most velocity and precision.

Pros

Hurl

  • You can throw all melee weapons that lack the Throw trait, improvised weapons, and handheld ammunition or objects, as if they have the "Throw (20/30)" weapon trait. 

Run-Up

  • If you do a run-up of 15ft before making a thrown attack, the first throw’s range increases by 15ft and its damage die increases by one size.
  • Weapons with the Throw trait double this bonus.

Weapon Pickup

  • You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to find your weapons, and you can pick up and then either stow or brandish it as a non-action.

Pass

  • With a controlled toss, you can freely hand-off objects to creatures over a distance as if next to them. Without needing to make a check, you can give an object that can be held in one hand to another creature up to 30ft away as if you were standing next to them, so long as they know it's coming.

Cons

Preoccupied

  • You cannot make attacks of opportunity.
